title: A Charming Heritage Stay That Feels Like Home in White Town
text:
**A Perfect Stay in the Heart of White Town!**
We stayed at **Dune De L’Orient**, 17 Romain Rolland Street, White Town, Puducherry, from **November 4 to 9, 2025**, and it was truly a delightful experience.
First and foremost, the **location is perfect** — right in the middle of White Town and just a two-minute walk from the promenade. There are plenty of lovely cafés nearby, but their **in-house restaurant** is equally good and definitely worth trying.
Our **room was spacious and beautifully decorated** in old French style, with tall 12-foot doors and windows — comfortable enough for three people. We had originally planned to stay for just three nights, but the experience was so wonderful that we **extended our stay**. It genuinely felt like a **second home**, thanks to the warm hospitality of the staff.
A special mention to **Tulsi**, the Manager at the reception, and **Ram** at the café — all are incredibly kind and helpful. The entire staff always greeted us with smiles and were ever ready to assist. **Breakfast was excellent**, and the café served delicious food — especially the **chef’s special risotto**, which was outstanding!
Tulsi also arranged **bikes for us to explore Pondicherry** and gave great suggestions on places to visit. The **building itself is stunning**, full of heritage charm, and exudes a cozy, homely feel.
We would **love to return** to Dune De L’Orient on our next visit to Pondicherry and **highly recommend** it to anyone looking for a comfortable, charming, and memorable stay in White Town.

title: Great choice for a resort spa outside Pondicherry
text:
Le Pondy is about 30 minutes south of Pondicherry and not easy to travel to or from the city without a car or taxi - it is in an isolated resort area next to a fishermen's village on the beach. If you're looking for a calm resort with great food and service, this is your place. 

The rooms are very nicely designed with front and back verandas, some with private pool. Bathrooms are luxe with walk in rain showers. The resort villas are in traditional South Indian style with thatched roofs and a long fish pond with lilies runs along the length of the resort. The grounds are well kept inside the resort. The restaurant food is excellent and the thrice daily buffet provides great value, although the repetitive muzak is rather off-putting. 

The swimming pool is certainly long but can get busy with families at times - in the morning and evening (<7pm) are quieter. The private beach is pleasant but the sea is dangerous for swimming because of the invisible shelf and undertow, there is a lifeguard on duty. Beyond the boundaries of the private beach, the sand is littered with garbage so a long walk is impractical and there was a never-ending stream of autogyro flights while I was there. 

The spa offers two types of massages - Indian Ayurvedic and "Hoshi", staffed by two separate teams. Hoshi offers Swedish, deep tissue and Balinese and is definitely the better choice if you know your preferences. Book ahead, appointments are only between 10am and 4pm and closed on Wednesdays. 

The staff are universally professional, courteous and helpful, especially if you're planning a sightseeing trip. Transfers are also available from Chennai airport. There is a well stocked boutique, where you can purchase handicrafts as well as sandals to wear on the beach.

title: Pleasant & relaxing stay at Dune
text:
We had a wonderful stay at Dune De L'orient for 3 nights. We liked the heritage aspect of the hotel and how they restored & preserved every piece of furniture. We feel transported back in time to a different era, and felt very relaxed something we were looking forward to in this trip. We stayed at Madurai the top most room. It takes a bit of climbing though to get to our room. The restaurant was a pleasant surprise as the salads and pastas tasted very well, when we had dinner there for 2 nights. We usually took a stroll from here to rock beach and several other landmarks which are all in very close proximity to the hotel.

Special mention of the staff here Priya, Tulasi, Shakti, Saran and Ram who took good care of us during our stay and made it a peaceful, relaxing one
